definition: to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield
"ice" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 15), occurring in 冰[bing1], 次[ci4] etc, known as 兩點水|两点水[liang3 dian3 shui3]
to offer sacrifices to the gods or ancestors
to offer sacrifices (to one's ancestors)/to hold or attend a memorial service
to offer sacrifices to one's ancestors
to perform the sacrificial rites at a funeral
to have a large and sumptuous meal (traditionally on the 1st and 15th of each month)
to offer a libation/person who performs the libation before a banquet/senior member of a profession/important government post in imperial China

sentences.english: He slaughtered the ox and the ram as the fellowship offering for the people.
sentences.chinese: 亚伦宰了那给百姓作平安祭的公牛和公绵羊。

sentences.english: Gion Matsuri, which is one of the most famous festivals in Japan, takes place in Kyoto, too.
sentences.chinese: 日本最有名庆典之一的祇园祭也在京都举行。

sentences.english: President Clinton revived a tough provision of U. S. trade law in an attempt.
sentences.chinese: 克林顿总统重新祭出美国贸易法中强硬的一条条文。

sentences.english: Beijing, the Ming and Qing emperors on the altar is the place on Festival.
sentences.chinese: 北京的月坛就是明清皇帝祭月的地方。

sentences.english: Later, aristocrats and literary figures helped expand the ceremony to common people.
sentences.chinese: 后来，贵族和文人学士把中秋祭月的传统推广到民间。

sentences.english: These norms are a concrete expression of the authentically ecclesial nature of the Eucharist;
sentences.chinese: 这些规范具体表达出感恩祭的真正教会特性。

sentences.english: The Body Mandala is surrounded by crescent-shaped areas, which are the offering grounds.
sentences.chinese: 身城被新月形地区环绕，此为祭地。

sentences.english: By the term human sacrifice, we mean executing people and afterwards interring them in a pit in order to worship the ancestors.
sentences.chinese: 把人强行处死后埋入坑内祭祀祖先，称为人祭。

sentences.english: He is the atoning sacrifice for our sins.
Tell the legends of QiXi Festival.
Lebanon is not sufficient for altar fires, nor its animals enough for burnt offerings.
sentences.chinese: 利巴嫩的树林不彀当柴烧，其中的走兽也不彀作燔祭。

sentences.english: And Lebanon is not sufficient to burn, nor the beasts thereof sufficient for a burnt offering.
sentences.chinese: 黎巴嫩的树林不够当柴烧，其中的走兽也不够作燔祭。

sentences.english: Remember all thy offerings, and accept thy burnt sacrifice; Selah.
sentences.chinese: 记念你的一切供献，悦纳你的燔祭。

sentences.english: Worshipping Pangu dates back to the ancient customs of Pangu totem worship and Pangu mythology.
sentences.chinese: 盘瓠祭起源于远古的盘瓠图腾崇拜和盘瓠神话。

sentences.english: And he shall put his hand upon the head of the burnt offering； and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.
sentences.chinese: 他要按手在燔祭牲的头上，燔祭便蒙悦纳，为他赎罪。

sentences.english: So they went in to make sacrifices and burnt offerings.
sentences.chinese: 耶户和约拿达进去，献平安祭和燔祭。

definition: to offer sacrifices (to one's ancestors)/to hold or attend a memorial service
to offer sacrifices to the gods or ancestors
to worship/to observe religious rites/to pay one's respects (to one's ancestors etc)
pouring of wine on ground for sacrifice
to offer sacrifices to one's ancestors
